tool.name: CloneItems

param.name: source
param.dialogReference: The url to the source ArcGIS Online or Enterprise organization containing the items to clone.

param.name: username
param.dialogReference: The username for the source ArcGIS Online or Enterprise organization. If left blank you will connect anonymously.

param.name: password
param.dialogReference: The password for the source ArcGIS Online or Enterprise organization. If left blank you will connect anonymously.

param.name: items
param.dialogReference: The list of IDs for the items you want to clone to the active portal.

param.name: folder
param.dialogReference: Output folder in your user content to write the items. If a folder by the name doesn't already exist a new folder will be created. If left blank the items will be created at the root folder in your user content.

param.name: copy_data
param.dialogReference: Copy the data for any features services or feature collections that are cloned.

param.name: search_for_existing_items
param.dialogReference: When enabled the tool will search the org to see if the item has already been cloned, and if so use it instead of cloning a duplicate. This is common if you have multiple web maps that share the same service. Rather than creating the service again it will find the already cloned version. If multiple versions of the item have been cloned to the org, the most recently created item will be used.

param.name: use_default_basemap
param.dialogReference: When enabled any web maps that are created will use the organization's default basemap.

param.name: add_gps_metadata_fields
param.dialogReference: When enabled GPS metadata fields will be added to new point feature layers so Collector for ArcGIS can write GPS metadata to the respective fields when editing point features.

tool.summary: Clone one or more items from the specified ArcGIS Online or Enterprise organization to the active portal.
